title: Opening Day Under the Gold Dome | Georgia House 2026 - Day 1 AM Session
summary:
Here is a structured markdown summary of the Georgia House 2026 - Day 1 AM Session:

# Overview
The Georgia House of Representatives held its opening day session, focusing on recognizing the work done by the Georgia Building Authority (GBA) to renovate and restore the House chamber. Key highlights included the use of Georgia-made carpet from Dalton and the replacement of the HVAC system dating back to the 1950s.

# Key Actions
No bills were passed or referred during this session.

# Bills Introduced (First Reading)
No new bills were introduced.

# Notable Moments
- The House recognized Gerald Pilgrim, Deputy Executive Director and Chief of Staff of the GBA, for the team's work in renovating the chamber.
- A video was shown highlighting the extensive renovation project, which involved over 500 employees and 400,000 man-hours of work.
- The Speaker thanked the GBA team, the Governor, and the First Lady for their dedication and support in completing the project.

# Votes
No recorded votes were taken.

# Attendance
The session maintained a quorum, with members present in the chamber.

# Adjournment
The session adjourned, with the next session date not specified.
